SENT.plain: It was reported that the local recurrence would be caused by cancer stem cells acquiring chemo- and radio-resistance
Recently, one of the potential therapeutic targets for colorectal and other cancers has been identified, which is maternal embryonic leucine zipper kinase (MELK)
MELK is known as an embryonic and neural stem cell marker, and associated with the cell survival, cell proliferation, and apoptosis
In this study, SNU-503, which is a rectal cancer cell line, was treated with radiation or 5-fluorouracil (5-FU), and elevation of the MELK expression level was observed
Furthermore, the cell line was pre-treated with small interfering RNA (siRNA) against MELK mRNA before treatment of radiation or 5-FU and its effects on cell cycle and proliferation were observed
We demonstrated that knockdown of MELK reduced the proliferation of cells with radiation or 5-FU treatment
In addition, MELK suppression caused changes in cell cycle
In conclusion, MELK could be associated with increased resistance of colorectal cancer cells against radiation and 5-FU
